benchmark_details.name: Hope Speech Detection in code-mixed Roman Urdu tweets
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces the first annotated dataset for hope speech detection in code-mixed Roman Urdu, aiming to fill a critical gap in existing NLP research for low-resource languages and informal communication. The dataset categorizes posts into Generalized Hope, Realistic Hope, Unrealistic Hope, and Not Hope.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive resource for detecting hope speech in code-mixed Roman Urdu and to improve NLP methodologies for low-resource languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset suffers from a lack of standardized spelling in Roman Urdu and potential ambiguities in labeling hope speech categories.

data.source: Tweets collected from X (formerly Twitter) based on keywords related to hope and non-hope sentiments.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by postgraduate Computer Science students with a majority voting system for label assignment.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on predictions from models trained on the dataset through 5-fold cross-validation.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 Score indicates better overall performance in accurately classifying hope speech.
methodology.validation: 5-fold cross-validation was employed for model evaluation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Identifiable details were removed from collected tweets to preserve user privacy.
